SEARCH
Package com.jeopardy

Class GameEvent

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.GameEvent
public class GameEvent extends Object
Represents an event that occurs during a Jeopardy game. GameEvents are used to track all activities and enable event-driven logging and reporting.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEvent

      public GameEvent(String caseId, int playerId, ActivityType activity, LocalDateTime timestamp, String category, int questionValue, String answerGiven, String result, int scoreAfterPlay)
      Constructs a GameEvent with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      caseId - the unique identifier for the game session
      playerId - the ID of the player involved in this event
      activity - the type of activity that occurred
      timestamp - the time when this event occurred
      category - the category name (if applicable to this event)
      questionValue - the point value of the question (if applicable)
      answerGiven - the answer provided by the player (if applicable)
      result - the result of the action (e.g., "Correct", "Incorrect")
      scoreAfterPlay - the player's score after this event
